p: In spite of the demonstrated potential of thyme and its constituents in vitro, its use as a food preservative has been limited by the organoleptic problem. In many food products, hydrophobic EO compounds are impaired by several interactions with the components of the food matrix, such as fat [ 105, 106], starch [ 107] and proteins [ 108]. Moreover, the antimicrobial properties of EO compounds also depend on pH [ 61], temperature [ 109] and microbial contamination [ 109].
